page.title: 04COLT HILL AND ODIHAM WHARF
page.content: The old London road leading to the Basingstoke Canal, is a quiet, no-through road, now the by-pass is finished. The Farnham by-pass carries a steady stream of fast moving traffic away from the main shopping area in the town. The Water-witch is a public house on Colt Hill, its gardens reach down to the canal bank. Rough grazing land stretches along the sides of the canal. Boats can be hired at the Wharf on Colt Hill, for pleasure cruises along the water-way. The barge ,named the "John Pinkerton", is used to ferry passengers along the open reaches of the canal to see "King John's Castle". The canal crosses the River Whitewater using an aqueduct, near the Castle and flows under the swing bridge. Hikers and walkers use the tow-path along one side of the canal to enjoy the scenery
